Home.what: CTE classes are rigorous courses which are part of a "career pathway" (a sequence of 2+ courses within a CTE industry sector), which enhance students' knowledge and career options. CTE classes prepare students to be college and career ready through exposure to a variety of specialized trainings, exploration opportunities, and connections to industry experts.
Home.unique:
They offer a high-quality CTE curriculum and instruction aligned to the CTE Model Curriculum Standards.
Provide career exploration and guidance opportunities for all pathway learners.
Advisory Committee meetings provide input to the CTE programs and curriculum.
Provide pathways for students to gain access to internships, and work-based learning (WBL) opportunities for industry.
Provide opportunities for students to participate in after school and out-of school activities and competitions. These programs create a “family atmosphere” and strong peer relationships opportunities for students.
If dual enrolled, potentially can provide more college credits than AP classes with no exam.

Animation.what: Animation is the process of taking 3D models or drawings to create an illusion of sequential movement, usually taking 25-50 frames per second to create a smooth, seamless motion. Industries that heavily use animation include film and TV, video game development, architecture, engineering, manufacturing, and healthcare.
Animation.connects: De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), Fresno, Fullerton, Long Beach, San Jose, UCLA, CA College of the Arts, Loyola Marymount
Animation.whatdo: 3D modelers build 3D objects and environments that are based on sketches or real-world objects using specialized computer software. Animators take 3D objects and bring them to life, giving them movement and animation using computer-generated imagery (CGI) software.

Architecture.what: Architectural design is the process of creating and designing plans for a residential home, building, office, structure, or landscape. It involves gathering important information on the needs, style, and wants for the project, and then crafting design options for the client or architect to review. Architectural design delivers blueprints for the construction team that will eventually build the project.
Architecture.connects: Chabot College (AA), City College of San Francisco, College of San Mateo (AA), West Valley College (AA), UC Berkeley, UCLA, Academy of Art University, Cal Poly, Southern CA Institute of Architecture
Architecture.whatdo: Architects create plans, drawings, and layouts for homes, buildings, and landscapes. They will meet with clients to discuss the project requirements and budget, as well as drafting layouts that reflect their client's needs and personality. Architectural designers work with CAD software to create blueprint designs, including technical specs that comply with local building regulations.

Design and Media Arts.what: Design, visual and media arts can help you take your creative talent, combine it with skills and technology, and turn you into an in-demand multimedia or graphic designer. Multimedia design involves computers, animation, photography, video, and printing, creating all sorts of things from posters and magazines to websites and online video games, to photos and videos.
Design and Media Arts.connects: De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), Fullerton State, UC Irvine, UCLA, UC San Diego
Design and Media Arts.whatdo: Design, visual and media arts professionals work in the entertainment, video game, or advertising industries, or 'in-house' at a traditional business. Animators create visuals for computer programs or games. Marketing departments design artwork and campaigns for presentations or marketing materials. Graphic designers create designs for print, video, and online applications.

Business.what: Business management involves managing the day-to-day operations of business organizations, whether managing the company as an owner, executive, or general manager, overseeing administration as an operations manager, or helping to support the business as an administrative assistant or receptionist.
Business.connects: De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), CAL State - San Diego, San Francisco, San Jose, UCLA, Cornell, Harvard, University of Pennsylvania
Business.whatdo: Managers and owners oversee day-to-day business operations, decide what products to make, and increase productivity of their business. Accountants and bookkeepers track invoices, payments, and revenue. Human resource and training professionals help employees find their full potential. Market research analysts gather and analyze data on clients and the marketplace.

Engineering.what: Engineering design is the process of creating a plan that will be used to build or make something, whether a small electronic device, a vacuum cleaner, or a machine that makes parts. The engineering design process involves multiple teams that work in tandem with one another, iterating and testing the process over and over, delivering a final process, solution, or prototype to be built or executed based on what's needed.
Engineering.connects: El Camino College (AA), Foothill College (AA), Corsiate, San Diego, Ang Berkeley, Davis, Los, Cal Maritime, Cal Poly, MIT, Stanford, USC
Engineering.whatdo: Engineers, engineering technicians, drafters, designers, and others work together through an iterative process that usually includes defining the problem or what needs to be built; identifying possible constraints; brainstorming different possible solutions; prototyping the most promising solution; testing and evaluating; iterating to make improvements; and communicating and delivering the final solution or plan.

Film and Video Production.what: Film and video production is the process of making a film, from the initial idea and storyline, to screenwriting, shooting film, sound recording, and post-production editing. Films today appear not only in theaters, but broadcast TV, cable, streaming services, and multiple internet platforms like YouTube. While it's easier than ever today to make a film with available technology, there are techniques and skills that are still required to achieve high-quality production.
Film and Video Production.connects: De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), San Francisco State, Los Angeles, Santa Barbara, Santa Cruz, CA Institute of the Arts, Stanford, TISCH
Film and Video Production.whatdo: Film directors are in charge of making, leading, and developing a film production, including funding, screenwriting, casting, film locations, filming, editing, and distribution. Camera operators are responsible for managing camera equipment and filming the scenes. Film editors organize digital footage with software to create the final film production.
jobs: Assistant Camera Operator, TV, Video, and Film

Games and Simulation.what: Game design is the use of creativity and design to develop video games for entertainment or educational purposes. It involves creating compelling stories, characters, environments, rules, and challenges that drive interactions with other characters, users, or objects. Game design crosses the fields of computer programming, creative writing, graphic design, and animation.
Games and Simulation.connects: Cabrillo College (AA), CAL State - Chico, East Bay, Los Angeles, Keley, Crime, Los Academy of Art University, SF University of Silicon Valley TISC
Games and Simulation.whatdo: Game designers are the creative force responsible for bringing a video game to life. They design the characters in the game, assist with the storyline and goals for the game, create the 'world' or environment where the game takes place, and create goals that users must achieve to make the game more engaging.

Graphic Design.what: Media arts can help you take your creative talent, combine it with skills and technology, and turn you into an in-demand multimedia or graphic designer. Multimedia design involves computers, animation, photography, video, and printing to create all sorts of things from posters and magazines to websites and online video games, to photos and videos.
Graphic Design.connects: De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), Porterville College (AA), San Jose State Art Center of College and Design, New York University, University of the Pacific
Graphic Design.whatdo: Graphic designers typically work for an entertainment, video game, or advertising agency, or 'in-house' at a traditional business, or even freelance working on their own. Animators create visuals for computer programs or games. If you work in a marketing department you might design artwork and campaigns for presentations or marketing materials. Graphic designers will be fluent in computer skills such as Adobe or HTML to help create online content and websites.

Health.what: Mental health focuses on a person's state of mind, referring to one's emotional, social, and psychological wellness. Behavioral health often includes mental health but also refers to how daily cognitive habits affect one's overall well-being, emotions, body, and behavior. Poor behavioral health habits, such as lack of sleep or eating disorders, often lead to poor mental and physical wellness.
Health.connects: Chabot College (AA), De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), MiraCosta College (AA), CAL State - Fullerton, San Jose, Cal Poly Pomona, California Baptist Univ., Palo Alto Univ., Southern New Hampshire Univ., USC
Health.whatdo: Psychologists conduct interviews and assessments with their patients, give diagnostic tests, perform therapy, and administer programs to help patients with their mental health issues. Behavioral therapists strive to understand the underlying habits and behaviors of their patients and create personalized strategies to eliminate poor behaviors at the root of the problem.

Hospitality.what: Culinary arts is the preparation, cooking, and presentation of food and meals. You will usually work in restaurants, most likely as a cook or chef in the kitchen, but also in 'front of the house' roles as a server, greeter, or maitre d. Catering for private events is a big business that involves preparing food for large events like weddings, conventions, or corporate meetings.
Hospitality.connects: Cabrillo College (AA), City College of San Francisco (AA), College of the Canyons (AA), Los Angeles Trade-Tech College (AA), Mission College (AA), Orange Coast College (AA), Santa Rosa Jr. College (AA), Cal State - East Bay, Long Beach, San Diego, San Francisco, San Jose, Cal Poly, Culinary Institute of America at Greystone, Institute of Culinary Education
Hospitality.whatdo: As a cook or chef you will plan menus, prepare food to be used for meals, cook and bake meals, and prepare the final presentation for the customer. Servers and hosts greet customers, take their orders, serve their food, and deliver great customer service. Nutritionists develop meal plans and menus that focus on improving diet and nutrition for their customers.

Manufacturing.what: Product innovation and design refer to the development of new products or improvements in the design, components, or manufacturing process of existing products. Product innovation can create brand new categories, like the invention of smartphones, or iterate on established products like using lighter, more durable materials in products.
Manufacturing.connects: City College of San Francisco (AA), San Diego City College (AA), Solano Community College (AA), CAL State - Fullerton, Long Beach, San Francisco, San Jose, Cal Poly, California College of the Arts, Otis College of Art and Design, Stanford
Manufacturing.whatdo: Product designers work to understand the needs of customers by observing user behavior and conducting market research to solve problems in the marketplace. They use computer-aided design (CAD) software to build renderings of new products and produce various prototypes to test, analyze, and iterate upon.

Software Development.what: Software development refers to using computer code to create, design, deploy, and support computer software. Computer software applications range from productivity software to create documents, gaming software to play video games, and video conferencing software to stay connected at school. Computer systems refer to the hardware, software, and networking systems that an organization uses to generate information and be productive.
Software Development.connects: De Anza College (AA), Foothill College (AA), CAL State - Sacramento, San Diego, San Jose, UC - Berkeley, Irvine, Merced, Cal Poly, Harvard, MIT, Santa Clara Univ., Stanford
Software Development.whatdo: Software development refers to using computer code to create, design, deploy, and support computer software. Computer software applications range from productivity software to create documents, gaming software to play video games, and video conferencing software to stay connected at school. Computer systems refer to the hardware, software, and networking systems that an organization uses to generate information and be productive.
